scenarioDescription:
The UKIRT-2017-BLG-001L Exoplanetary System


Overview

UKIRT-2017-BLG-001L is a star with 0.81 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 20547.83 light years away from the solar system.

UKIRT-2017-BLG-001L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the UKIRT-2017-BLG-001L system


UKIRT-2017-BLG-001L b

UKIRT-2017-BLG-001L b was discovered by the Mauna Kea Observatory observatory, in 2018-04, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 4.18 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of UKIRT-2017-BLG-001L b is 407.040 times the mass of Earth. The radius of UKIRT-2017-BLG-001L b is 13.700 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, UKIRT-2017-BLG-001L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system UKIRT-2017-BLG-001L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Mauna Kea Observatory.
name: UKIRT-2017-BLG-001L - System With 1 Exoplanet
